name: OSINT Tools and Methods
description: Techniques and tools for gathering intelligence from publicly available online sources.

cards.title: Automated Web Scraping for OSINT
cards.description: Using automation to extract intelligence from online sources.
bulletpoints: Use Python libraries like BeautifulSoup and Scrapy for scraping
Set up proxies and user-agent rotation to avoid detection
Extract structured data from forums, news, and public websites

cards.title: Metadata Extraction and File Analysis
cards.description: Analyzing metadata from documents, images, and digital files for intelligence.
bulletpoints: Extract metadata using ExifTool, FOCA, and CyberChef
Analyze timestamps, geolocation, and authorship data
Identify digital forgeries and document tampering

cards.title: Analyzing Image Metadata with ExifTool
cards.description: Using ExifTool to extract metadata from images and digital media.
bulletpoints: Extract geolocation, timestamps, and device details from images
Identify hidden metadata that reveals source information
Cross-reference metadata with OSINT databases

cards.title: FOCA for Document Metadata Analysis
cards.description: Using FOCA to extract metadata from documents for OSINT investigations.
bulletpoints: Analyze metadata in PDFs, Word, and Excel documents
Reveal author, editing history, and network paths
Use FOCA for reconnaissance on leaked or public corporate documents

cards.title: Data Analysis and Transformation with CyberChef
cards.description: Using CyberChef for encoding, decoding, and data extraction in OSINT.
bulletpoints: Extract hidden data from encoded or encrypted strings
Automate text manipulation, decryption, and hashing
Analyze network traffic, steganography, and forensic artifacts

cards.title: Using Shodan for Network OSINT
cards.description: Leveraging Shodan to identify exposed devices and infrastructure.
bulletpoints: Scan public IPs for exposed services and vulnerabilities
Identify open ports, webcams, and industrial control systems
Monitor for leaked credentials and misconfigured databases

cards.title: Graph-based OSINT with Maltego
cards.description: Using Maltego for link analysis and visual intelligence mapping.
bulletpoints: Map connections between domains, emails, and organizations
Use transforms to enrich OSINT data from public and private sources
Analyze relationships between individuals, networks, and entities

cards.title: Google Dorking for Deep Search OSINT
cards.description: Using advanced Google search operators to uncover hidden information.
bulletpoints: Find exposed documents, databases, and login pages
Use site: and filetype: operators for targeted searches
Identify sensitive information leaks in public websites

cards.title: Domain Intelligence with WHOIS
cards.description: Extracting information about domains, registrants, and IP addresses.
bulletpoints: Identify domain ownership, creation date, and hosting provider
Analyze historical WHOIS records for infrastructure tracking
Cross-reference domain data with OSINT threat databases

cards.title: Investigating Archived Websites with Wayback Machine
cards.description: Using archived versions of websites for OSINT research.
bulletpoints: Retrieve deleted web pages and historical site data
Identify content changes over time for forensic analysis
Use archived pages to investigate cyber threats and misinformation

cards.title: Extracting Social Media Intelligence with Twint
cards.description: Using Twint to collect Twitter data without API restrictions.
bulletpoints: Scrape Twitter data for usernames, hashtags, and geolocation
Analyze tweet sentiment and network connections
Extract deleted tweets and investigate digital footprints

cards.title: OSINT Framework: Finding the Right Tools
cards.description: Exploring the OSINT Framework to identify the best tools for investigations.
bulletpoints: Navigate the OSINT Framework to find category-specific tools
Use pre-built collections of tools for SOCMINT, GEOINT, and more
Understand the role of automation in streamlining OSINT workflows

cards.title: Reverse Image Search for OSINT
cards.description: Using image search tools to track visuals across the web.
bulletpoints: Use Google Reverse Image Search, Yandex, and TinEye
Identify duplicate images and track their origins
Find manipulated images, deepfakes, and fraudulent profiles

cards.title: Geospatial Intelligence (GEOINT) with OpenStreetMap
cards.description: Using OpenStreetMap and satellite imagery for OSINT.
bulletpoints: Analyze satellite imagery for location intelligence
Identify buildings, terrain, and movement patterns
Cross-reference geolocation data with other OSINT sources
